result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L Hogan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court with attorney Benjamin John Krautkramer. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF422, 16CF5, 16CF6, 16CF195

11:46 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF5 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
16CF6 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF5, 16CF6.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF422 and 16CF195 are dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Krautkramer makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
16CF6 -
Sentence Withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 
Continue with AODA treatment program. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Sign all necessary releases. 
Obtain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or combination for fulltime.
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by her agent. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit DNA sample if not already done so. 

16CF5 -
180 days jail - STAYED -
First 90 days must be in jail.  Second 90 days can be on GPS monitoring if approved by jail administration and RISK assessment. 
Huber for employment, counseling and treatment.  
Placed on 36 months probation, concurrent: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 16CF6. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Any bond monies posted in any of the files shall be applied to the costs in these cases.

Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court with attorney Benjamin John Krautkramer. Defendant Amanda L Hogan in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases heard for initial appearances 16CF5 and 16CF6 then heard for preliminary along with 15CF422.

Initial Appearance Hearing on 16CF5 and 16CF6
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

Preliminary Hearings on 15CF422, 16CF5 and 16CF6
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Informations have been filed and arraignment been set.

BTC: Bond in 15CF422 will cover cases 16CF5 & 16CF6  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  3 times per week.

Defendant Amanda L Hogan in cour with Atty Benjamin Krautkramer. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:32 Court calls case.

Defendant failed to show for an Adjourned Initial Appearance on 12/14/15.

Defendant makes a statement.
Court informs the defendant needs to appear at all court hearings.
Atty Cousins makes statements regarding bond on the record.
Atty Cousins is requesting a cash bond in the amount of $1,000.00.
Defendant makes statements regarding her employment 

BY THE COURT:
Warrant quashed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
